summary: This mod adds a follower who is a giant.  (Sorry, he is too big to go into dungeons with you.)
descriptionHtml:
Mod:  Readme - Giant Companion 1_0
Game:  TES V: Skyrim
Author:  David Brasher                                          
Date:  2/26/12                   
************************************************************************
CONTENTS                          
************************************************************************
1. Information on the Mod
2. Installation
3. Version History
4. Conflicts, Known Issues, and Troubleshooting
5. Copy Status and Credits
************************************************************************
1. INFORMATION ON THE MOD           
************************************************************************
	   This mod adds a follower who is a giant.  (Sorry, he is too big to go into dungeons with you.)

	   You can find the giant on the road west of Whiterun south-east of the Sleeping Tree giant camp. 
	   	   
	   The giant accepts the \"Join Me\", \"Wait\", \"Follow\", \"Share\", and \"Dismiss\" commands.

	   He uses original voiced dialog.  (He is a giant of few words.  Sort of the strong silent type.)

	   When you go inside a dungeon or building, your giant will wait outside for you and still be there
when you get back.  He is too tall for going inside places like that.

	   He is a bit slow when walking, and won\'t go indoors, but if you need a really powerful ally for 
an outdoor battle, then this might be a good companion for you. 
************************************************************************
2. Installation                           
************************************************************************
           Extract (decompress) the .esp, Scripts, and Sound folders to your Skyrim directory.  
(It will be something like *Installation directory*\\Skyrim\\SteamApps\\common\\Skyrim\\Data)
Mark the box next to Giant Companion.esp in your mod manager.
 
           Alternately, extract files someplace else.  Then move the .esp files, scripts, and sounds 
to Skyrim\\Data.  Mark the box next to the plugin in your mod manager.
************************************************************************
3. Version History    
************************************************************************
V 1.0    2/26/12   Initial release.   
************************************************************************
4. Conflicts, Known Issues, and Troubleshooting
************************************************************************
	   This mod is a bit silly.

	   This mod is expected to conflict with many other mods that edit giants.  Because of mesh and
texture problems that I do not understand, I had to edit the vanilla Skyrim giant race instead of using
my own new race.  So this mod will directly conflict with other mods that edit the original giant race.
	   
	   The game becomes too easy when you use too many followers. (Especially really powerful ones.)

	   On several occasions during testing, there was so much lag that the dialog options with the 
giant would not work.  They started working again when there was less lag.  

	   On two occasions, the giant\'s club did not render and he was carrying around an invisible 
club.  I never edited the club, so this sounds like a vanilla Skyrim glitch to me.

	   I had to speed up the giant and slow down the mammoths in their stats menus.  So now the 
giant\'s walking animation does not always look right.  He sometimes sort of glides along if he is moving
especially fast.

	   You should not take your giant and his mammoths to town.  The mammoths tend to get in fights.

	   For some reason, when you fast travel, the mammoths arrive right where you do, and the giant 
arrives some distance away and you might not see him at first.
	
	   If you locate a bug, contact David Brasher on TES Nexus so that the situation can be
examined and can hopefully be fixed. 
************************************************************************
5. Copy Status and Credits           
************************************************************************
Credits:  Bethesda for making Skyrim in an open format anyone can mod.
		
Copy Status:  Public domain with proper attribution and courtesy notification.  You may use things from 
this mod in your own mods and distribute them if you list me in the credits and send me a message on Skyrim
Nexus stating that you have done this.        
************************************************************************
************************************************************************
************************************************************************
************************************************************************
author: David Brasher
